channel.title: Matrix client
channel.description:
When i open the matrix client, he gets a game crash, this error
[code]Error: jn.a() fb.d() lk.a() client.er() client.ae() mc.m() mc.e() | Class225.met hod2094:57 Class125.method1401:283 Class275.method2573:59 client.method2806:3710 client.method2773:652 Class291.method2764:641 Class291.method2759:457 Class291. run:384 java.lang.Thread.run | java.lang.RuntimeException | 0,0,0,0 0,0,0, 3 0 2 765,503 0 0 0 0 0 0 248 12 -1 hAJWGrsaETglRjuwxMwnlA/d5W6EgYWx java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://127.0.0.1/clienterror.ws?c=718&cs=1&u=0&v1 =Oracle+Corporation&v2=1.7.0_05&e=jn.a%28%29+fb.d%28%29+lk.a%28%29+client.er%28% 29+client.ae%28%29+mc.m%28%29+mc.e%28%29+%7C+Class225.method2094%3A57+Class125.m ethod1401%3A283+Class275.method2573%3A59+client.method2806%3A3710+client.method2 773%3A652+Class291.method2764%3A641+Class291.method2759%3A457+Class291.run%3A384 +java.lang.Thread.run+%7C+java.lang.RuntimeException+%7C++0%2C0%2C0%2C0+0%2C0%2C 0%2C+3+0+2+765%2C503+0+0+0+0+0+0+248+12+-1+hAJWGrsaETglRjuwxMwnlA%2Fd5W6EgYWx at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at java.net.URL.openStream(Unknown Source) at IPAddress.method6062(IPAddress.java:171) at Class291.run(Class291.java:388) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) error_game_crash[/code]
help

item.title: Matrix client
item.dc:creator: @phoenixrising phoenixrising
item.description:
@phoenixrising wrote:

mod ap:

I am having the same issue. It’s a wonder that this forum is called the “Client Help” forum, yet noone ever seems to respond. By the way, to those reading this “fix it yourself” is nearly impossible. If the problem is unique to a certain client, this means that the problem CANNOT BE GOOGLED. So, if you could please, help us on this issue.

It’s highly unlikely to recieve help. I’m having issues with multiple clients, 317 and higher, multiple bases. Noone’s here to help anymore, RSPS is becoming a waste of time.

Read full topic

I am having the same issue. It’s a wonder that this forum is called the “Client Help” forum, yet noone ever seems to respond. By the way, to those reading this “fix it yourself” is nearly impossible.
